comments.body: Good point. For moving towards a production class executor, I guess we should also try to reschedule / handle these tasks. For example, it might make more sense to keep framework state in a local db (or as is more common amongst mesos frameworks, in zookeeper), instead of in-memory. Further, that will also be useful when we move towards HA for airflow scheduler (say https://github.com/airbnb/airflow/issues/392 ). May be we can open an issue and take this up sometime later.

This is not as big a problem as it looks because [get_event_buffer](https://github.com/airbnb/airflow/blob/master/airflow/executors/base_executor.py#L97) is only called by [BackfillJob](https://github.com/airbnb/airflow/blob/master/airflow/jobs.py#L641).
